title: Authors and Citation
text: Colin Brust. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Brust C (2023). ETo: Daily Calculation Reference ET. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://mt-climate-office.github.io/ETo/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ETo: Daily Calculation of Reference ET},   author = {Colin Brust},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://mt-climate-office.github.io/ETo/}, }

title: Daily Calculation of Reference ET
text: ETo provides basic utility functions calculating point-based spatial daily reference ET. Currently, Penman-Monteith Hargreaves methods implemented. Functions also provided calculate necessary intermediate variables calculating ETo. input variables needed calculate ETo daily average temperature, min temperature max temperature (Hargreaves), daily average temperature, relative humidity, solar radiation windspeed (Penman-Monteith).

title: Daily Calculation of Reference ET
text: can install development version ETo GitHub :

title: Daily Calculation of Reference ET
text: , downscaled CMIP6 data Montana provided package used calculate compare different ETo methods:
code: library(ETo)  # Load data. Need to read with terra::rast to unpack to a raster. srad <- terra::rast(srad) |> terra::subset(1:10) tmean <- terra::rast(tmean) |> terra::subset(1:10)  # Convert from K to C tmean <- tmean - 273.15 tmax <- terra::rast(tmax) |> terra::subset(1:10)  # Convert from K to C tmax <- tmax - 273.15 tmin <- terra::rast(tmin) |> terra::subset(1:10)  # Convert from K to C tmin <- tmin - 273.15 rh <- terra::rast(rh) |> terra::subset(1:10) ws <- terra::rast(ws) |> terra::subset(1:10)  # Get a raster grid of elevation for the domain. elev <- get_elev_from_raster(tmean, z = 3) #> Warning: [boundaries] boundary detection is only done for the first layer  # Calculate timeseries of Penman Montieth penman <- calc_etr_spatial(  tmean = tmean, srad = srad, rh = rh, ws = ws,  method = "penman", reference = 0.23, elev = elev )  # Calculate timeseries of Hargreaves hargreaves <- calc_etr_spatial(  tmean = tmean, tmax = tmax, tmin = tmin, method = "hargreaves", elev = elev )  diff <- penman - hargreaves  # Plot the difference (in mm) between the two methods. terra::plot(diff, range = c(-0.6, 1.5))

what: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
text: Assumes inputs share resolution, extent, projection. Also assumes rasters number layers layer corresponding day. hargreaves, tmean, tmin tmax required arguments. PM, tmean, srad, rh, ws must supplied.

title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
code: calc_etr_spatial(   tmean,   tmin = NULL,   tmax = NULL,   srad = NULL,   rh = NULL,   ws = NULL,   elev = NULL,   days = NULL,   reference = 0.23,   z = 9,   method = "penman" )

title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
text: tmean multilayer timeseries terra::rast mean daily temperature degrees C. tmin multilayer timeseries terra::rast max daily temperature degrees C. tmax multilayer timeseries terra::rast min daily temperature degrees C. srad multilayer timeseries terra::rast daily solar radiation W m^-2. rh multilayer timeseries terra::rast mean daily relative humidity (%). ws multilayer timeseries terra::rast mean daily wind speed 2m height m s^-1. elev terra::rast elevation meters. left blank, elevation derived using elevatr package. days multilayer timeseries terra::rast day constant value Julian day. left blank, assumed tmean input time attribute raster derived using terra::time. reference albedo reference surface ranging 0 - 1. Defaults 0.23 grass. z zoom level download elevation data ranging 1 - 14. One coarser resolution, 14 finer resolution. information, look ?elevatr::get_elev_raster method method calculate ETo. Can either "penman" "hargreaves".

title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
text: terra::rast timeseries ETo input domain.

title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
code: if (FALSE) { # Load data. Need to read with terra::rast to unpack to a raster. srad <- terra::rast(srad) |> terra::subset(1:10) tmean <- terra::rast(tmean) |> terra::subset(1:10) # Convert from K to C tmean <- tmean - 273.15 tmax <- terra::rast(tmax) |> terra::subset(1:10) # Convert from K to C tmax <- tmax - 273.15 tmin <- terra::rast(tmin) |> terra::subset(1:10) # Convert from K to C tmin <- tmin - 273.15 rh <- terra::rast(rh) |> terra::subset(1:10) ws <- terra::rast(ws) |> terra::subset(1:10)  penman <- calc_etr_spatial(   tmean = tmean, srad = srad, rh = rh, ws = ws,   method = "penman", reference = 0.23, z = 3 ) hargreaves <- calc_etr_spatial(   tmean = tmean, tmax = tmax, tmin = tmin, method = "hargreaves", z = 3 ) }

title: Calculate reference ET using the Hargreaves method. — etr_hargreaves
text: tmin minimum air temperature deg C. tmax maximum air temperature deg C. tmean average air temperature deg C. lat latitude measurements degrees. srad Downwelling shortwave radiaiton W m^-2.
